alert.note: Alert for Western Kenai Peninsula (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 02 at 7:01AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...LIGHT SNOW AND AREAS OF BLOWING AND DRIFTING SNOW TO PERSIST THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... A band of snow persists this morning from Ninilchik north along the Sterling Highway to Kenai and Soldotna. The heaviest and most persistent snowfall has been around Kenai, where 3 to 6 inches of snow has fallen as of 6am AKDT. The snow is expected to diminish in intensity over the next couple of hours before redeveloping later this morning and lifting north across the region through early afternoon. An additional 1 to 3 inches of snow is possible before the snow tapers off this afternoon. Gusty winds with this storm system will also produce areas of blowing and drifting snow along the Sterling Highway. Please use caution when traveling. Blowing snow and resuspended snow from vehicles may reduce visibility along area roadways at times.
